security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, no file writes, and no network calls in the skill definition itself. The skill uses standard research tools (Read, Grep, Glob, WebSearch, WebFetch) appropriately scoped for best practice research.

content.value_statement: Developers often struggle to find current industry standards and proven approaches for implementation challenges. This skill provides researched best practices, design patterns, and recommendations tailored to specific project contexts.
actual_capabilities: Discover current industry standards and best practices for software development
Identify and explain design patterns with use case recommendations
Analyze codebases to evaluate existing patterns against best practices
Compare implementation approaches with trade-off analysis
Provide context-specific recommendations with code examples
Research using web sources, documentation, and codebase analysis
limitations: Recommendations are based on research and general best practices, not project-specific requirements
Does not execute code or make changes to user projects
Web research is limited to publicly available documentation and resources
Cannot access private repositories or internal company documentation

use_cases.title: Architecture and Design Decisions

use_cases.title: Security Best Practices

use_cases.title: Code Quality Standards
use_cases.description: Establish team coding standards, testing strategies, and code review checklists

prompt_templates.title: Authentication Approach

prompt_templates.title: API Design
prompt_templates.prompt: What are the best practices for designing a RESTful API for a CRUD application?

prompt_templates.title: Code Organization

prompt_templates.title: Security Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my authentication code against security best practices and suggest improvements

output_examples.input: What are best practices for error handling in JavaScript?
output: Use try-catch blocks for synchronous operations, async-await with proper error propagation
Create custom error types for specific failure scenarios
Include contextual information in error messages without exposing sensitive data
Implement error boundaries in React to prevent component crashes from breaking the app
Use structured logging with correlation IDs for debugging distributed systems

best_practices: Always provide context about your tech stack when asking for recommendations
Request trade-off analysis when choosing between multiple approaches
Ask for specific code examples aligned with your existing codebase patterns
Follow up with questions about migration paths when updating existing code
anti_patterns: Asking for outdated practices without specifying a time period
Ignoring project constraints when evaluating recommendations
Applying patterns without understanding the reasoning behind them
Skipping security considerations for non-critical features

faq.question: What programming languages and frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: Recommendations cover major languages including JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Java, and Rust with framework-specific guidance for React, Next.js, Vue, Angular, and Node.js.

faq.question: How current are the best practices?
faq.answer: The skill researches current standards from official documentation and community resources, prioritizing 2024-2025 practices.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This is a research and advisory skill only. It provides recommendations but never writes or changes any code.

faq.question: How does the skill research information?
faq.answer: It uses codebase analysis (Read, Grep, Glob) to understand your project and web search (WebSearch, WebFetch) to research external standards.

faq.question: Can I use this for security audits?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes comprehensive security checklists based on OWASP Top 10 and can review code against security best practices.

faq.question: How is this different from a general coding assistant?
faq.answer: This skill specializes in research methodology, providing evidence-based recommendations with trade-off analysis rather than quick answers.
